form.label: HOWTO TOP: Generate stats and charts with Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL)
form.description: This collection of request samples will help you generating your own reports, dashboards and alerts for Nmon Performance data using the native Search Processing Language

panel.title: Optionally preset frameID, hostname, Command and press Enter:
Time oriented and statistics oriented charts:

div.h2: By Server / Program Analysis: Core CPU usage of main processes (consuming more than 0.01 logical core on the host) in multi-series hosts represented by a stacked area chart
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,hostname,Command | eval value=(pct_CPU/100) | where value>0.01 | eval key=hostname+":"+Command | timechart `nmon_span` limit=0 useother=f max(value) As value by key

div.h2: By Program Analysis: Aggregation of Core CPU usage of main processes (consuming more than 0.01 logical core on the host) by command invocation represented by a stacked area chart
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,hostname,Command | eval value=(pct_CPU/100) | where value>0.01 | bucket _time `nmon_span` | stats max(value) As value by _time,hostname,Command | stats sum(value) AS value by _time,Command | timechart `nmon_span` useother=f max(value) AS value by Command

div.h2: By Server / Program Analysis with limit serie of available core (will be agregated if multiple hosts are concerned by the search): Core CPU usage of main processes (consuming more than 0.01 logical core on the host) in multi-series hosts represented by a stacked area chart
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,hostname,Command | eval value=(pct_CPU/100) | where value>0.01 | bucket _time `nmon_span` | stats max(value) As value by _time,hostname,Command | stats sum(value) AS value by _time,Command | timechart `nmon_span` useother=f max(value) AS value by Command | appendcols [ search eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,hostname | stats sum(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time | timechart `nmon_span` max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus ] | fields _time,*,logical_cpus

div.h2: Single TOP Command Average Logical Core usage over last 24 hours
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,hostname,Command | eval value=(pct_CPU/100) | where value>0.01 | stats avg(value) AS logical_core_usage by hostname,Command | stats (logical_core_usage) AS logical_core_usage by Command | sort - logical_core_usage | eval logical_core_usage=round(logical_core_usage, 3) | head 1 | eval stat=Command + " / " + logical_core_usage + " Avg CPU logical core usage" | fields stat

div.h2: Single TOP Command Max Logical Core usage over last 24 hours
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,hostname,Command | eval value=(pct_CPU/100) | where value>0.01 | stats max(value) AS logical_core_usage by hostname,Command | stats sum(logical_core_usage) AS logical_core_usage by Command | sort - logical_core_usage | eval logical_core_usage=round(logical_core_usage, 3) | head 1 | eval stat=Command + " / " + logical_core_usage + " Max CPU logical core usage" | fields stat

div.h2: Column chart of TOP 10 average CPU Usage in Percentage over last 24 hours, each column represents an instance of the main serie (with label on botton of each Command, all columns will have the same color)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command | eval value=(pct_CPU/100) | where value>0.01 | stats sum(value) AS value by _time,Command | stats avg(value) as "CPU Logical Core usage" by Command | sort - "CPU Logical Core usage" | head 10 | sort Command

div.h2: Column chart of TOP 10 average CPU Usage in Percentage over last 24 hours, each column is a serie representing a Command invocation (series are named by the legend, different color per Command)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command | eval value=(pct_CPU/100) | where value>0.01 | stats sum(value) AS value by _time,Command | stats avg(value) AS value by Command | sort - value | head 10 | eval xlabel="" | chart useother=f limit=0 avg(value) as usage_per_core by xlabel,Command | rename xlabel AS "TOP 10 CPU % usage"

div.h2: Max / Average CPU Usage in Logical Cores and Global % usage over last 24 hours ordered and sorted by Max Core Usage, frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=TOP frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ Command=$Command$ | bucket _time span=1m | stats max(pct_CPU) AS pct_CPU, max(logical_cpus) AS logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command,PID | eval limit=(logical_cpus*100) | where (pct_CPU<=limit) | stats sum(pct_CPU) As pct_CPU, last(logical_cpus) As logical_cpus by _time,frameID,hostname,Command | eval cpu_usage_core=(pct_CPU/100) | eval cpu_usage_global=(pct_CPU/logical_cpus) | where cpu_usage_core>0.01 | stats max(cpu_usage_core) AS max_cpu_usage_core, max(cpu_usage_global) AS max_cpu_usage_global, avg(cpu_usage_core) AS avg_cpu_usage_core, avg(cpu_usage_global) AS avg_cpu_usage_global, sparkline(max(cpu_usage_core)) As sparkline by frameID,hostname,Command | sort - max_cpu_usage_core,hostname,frameID,hostname | foreach max_* avg_* [ eval <<FIELD>>=round(<<FIELD>>, 2) ] | rename max_cpu_usage_core AS "Max CPU usage in logical core", max_cpu_usage_global AS "Max CPU usage in % of global capacity", avg_cpu_usage_core AS "Avg CPU usage in logical core", avg_cpu_usage_global AS "Avg CPU usage in % of global capacity"
